raw.title: [BIP-552] Authorize Mimic Smart Vaults V3 on Arbitrum, Polygon and Gnosis
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payloads
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/820

## Motivation

The Balancer Maxis have worked closely together with Mimic to streamline and automate protocol fee processing on all Balancer deployments. In an initial phase, Mimic used their smart vault v2 architecture to process fees. In a second phase, we migrated Mainnet, Avalanche and Base fee processing to their smart vault v3 architecture as ratified in [[BIP-488]](https://snapshot.org/#/balancer.eth/proposal/0x897aba7b7f3a68867595fea782931da3aae10fc15c62d8ace8cbd8e923ac07c4). One can review[ [BIP-294]](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-294-authorize-mimic-smart-vault-on-arbitrum/4779) which authorized Mimic on Arbitrum for more information on the particulars of v2, as well as [[BIP-115]](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-115-balancer-smart-vaults-fee-collector/3966) for the original development plan.

Given the success of the fee processing automation program, we propose to further authorize the Mimic smart vault v3 on Arbitrum, Polygon and Gnosis. Permissions of the currently in use smart vault v2 will be revoked once smart vault v3 fee processing is fully operational.

## Specification

### Arbitrum

The DAO Multisig on Arbitrum `0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` and call grantRole with the following arguments:

role: `0x93b1b7dba9fb074b573d5edb3c983e0490a00925f709289485f0c75988e100cf`

which corresponds to the role for calling withdrawCollectedFees on the ProtocolFeeWithdrawer on Arbitrum, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/d280e55dbe0fe4a2570912567fc7ccbf3dbbe1d7/action-ids/arbitrum/action-ids.json#L242).

account: `0x9e5D6427D2cdaDC68870197b099C2Df535Ec3c97`

which is the contract address for the Mimic smart vault on Arbitrum.

### Polygon

The DAO Multisig on Polygon `0xeE071f4B516F69a1603dA393CdE8e76C40E5Be85` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` and call grantRole with the following arguments:

role: `0x25995e0bfb9b837ed9e3ed24df7d42689be47c45073cc1953bb0836b292faa13`

which corresponds to the role for calling withdrawCollectedFees on the ProtocolFeeWithdrawer on Polygon, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/d280e55dbe0fe4a2570912567fc7ccbf3dbbe1d7/action-ids/polygon/action-ids.json#L295).

account: `0x9e5D6427D2cdaDC68870197b099C2Df535Ec3c97`

which is the contract address for the Mimic smart vault on Polygon.

### Gnosis

The DAO Multisig on Gnosis `0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` and call grantRole with the following arguments:

role: `0xf6c9a5b5acca77f76aed5abd6f810c52c3ff5f4a8a40ee9e1bc09f85795e73da`

which corresponds to the role for calling withdrawCollectedFees on the ProtocolFeeWithdrawer on Gnosis, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/d280e55dbe0fe4a2570912567fc7ccbf3dbbe1d7/action-ids/gnosis/action-ids.json#L58C64-L58C130).

account: `0x9e5D6427D2cdaDC68870197b099C2Df535Ec3c97`

which is the contract address for the Mimic smart vault on Gnosis.

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/459

### Motivation

Gnosis Chain has grown enough that we can now start processing earned protocol fees. There's currently ~$13k accumulated in the fee collector. You can review [BIP-294](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-294-authorize-mimic-smart-vault-on-arbitrum/4779) which authorized Mimic on Arbitrum for more information on the particulars. 

### Specification

The DAO Multisig on Gnosis `gno:0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` and call grantRole with the following arguments:

role: `0xf6c9a5b5acca77f76aed5abd6f810c52c3ff5f4a8a40ee9e1bc09f85795e73da`

which corresponds to the role for calling withdrawCollectedFees on the ProtocolFeeWithdrawer on Gnosis, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/action-ids/gnosis/action-ids.json#L58C64-L58C130).

account: 0x94Dd9C6152a2A0BBcB52d3297b723A6F01D5F9f7

which is the contract address for the Mimic smart vault on Gnosis.

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/631

### Motivation

The core purpose of the proposal is to take the manual labor of handling protocol fees out of the hands of the Balancer Maxis and automate the process to make the DAO as streamlined and sustainable as possible. Protocol fees are accruing on all networks at a healthy rate and Mimic is at the point where they are capable of managing this process in an automated way. One can review [BIP-294](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-294-authorize-mimic-smart-vault-on-arbitrum/4779) which authorized Mimic on Arbitrum for more information on the particulars, as well as [BIP-115](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-115-balancer-smart-vaults-fee-collector/3966) for the original development plan. This proposal will authorize Mimic vaults on Mainnet, Avalanche, and Base to execute the same automation. These vaults are using Mimic v3, as opposed to v2 like the prior instances. Addresses can be confirmed [here](https://www.notion.so/mimic-fi/Balancer-Fee-Collector-v3-Test-Base-Avalanche-and-Mainnet-instructions-89bda03acb7b4cf09b2bb2794eb0fa31?pvs=4#89b9190d21c240409f6eabca86c8778c). 

### Specification

#### Mainnet

The DAO Multisig on Ethereum `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` and call grantRole with the following arguments:

role: `0x826ac7ce861f2a54e071e6c724653757fdd1259804eb1ca7f040aa1cd09923fe`

which corresponds to the role for calling withdrawCollectedFees on the ProtocolFeeWithdrawer on Ethereum, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/046a1e24803a48ce02196de3474066bda26d3bb6/action-ids/mainnet/action-ids.json#L534).

account: `0x9e5D6427D2cdaDC68870197b099C2Df535Ec3c97`

which is the contract address for the Mimic smart vault on [Ethereum](https://etherscan.io/address/0x9e5d6427d2cdadc68870197b099c2df535ec3c97#code).

#### Avalanche
The DAO Multisig on Avalanche `0x17b11FF13e2d7bAb2648182dFD1f1cfa0E4C7cf3` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` and call grantRole with the following arguments:

role: `0x9b7cac7a6e50200d3ceb1372c25ac2f697fa4ba4495fb37091ffc35e5b4f8a42`

which corresponds to the role for calling withdrawCollectedFees on the ProtocolFeeWithdrawer on Avalanche, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/046a1e24803a48ce02196de3474066bda26d3bb6/action-ids/avalanche/action-ids.json#L83).

account: 0x9e5D6427D2cdaDC68870197b099C2Df535Ec3c97

which is the contract address for the Mimic smart vault on [Avalanche](https://snowtrace.io/address/0x9e5d6427d2cdadc68870197b099c2df535ec3c97).

 #### Base
The DAO Multisig on Base `0xC40DCFB13651e64C8551007aa57F9260827B6462` will interact with the Authorizer `0x809B79b53F18E9bc08A961ED4678B901aC93213a` and call grantRole with the following arguments:

role: `0xe4041b7c17d9c1871f2ba2855b724e8cdbb7c190bc2fbfaab37f914aa5ead4e9`

which corresponds to the role for calling withdrawCollectedFees on the ProtocolFeeWithdrawer on Base, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/046a1e24803a48ce02196de3474066bda26d3bb6/action-ids/base/action-ids.json#L142C64-L142C130).

account: `0x9e5D6427D2cdaDC68870197b099C2Df535Ec3c97`

which is the contract address for the Mimic smart vault on [Base](https://basescan.org/address/0x9e5d6427d2cdadc68870197b099c2df535ec3c97).

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-272] Weighted Pool v1 Permission Granting
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
#### PR with payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/157

### Motivation

Vesta Finance has requested the swap fee be changed on WETH/VSTA [Arbitrum] to 1% but the Maxis currently lack the role to do so. They plan to use this pool as part of a staking/farming system. This proposal grants the Maxi LM multisig on Arbitrum the role for changing swap fees on v1 weighted pools on Arbitrum.

### Specification

The DAO Multisig on Arbitrum `arb1:0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x6213e9042b9814b9567bde72d3c7a61372862c3ac88c2df77d3205221af6c871`

can be confirmed [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/master/pkg/deployments/action-ids/arbitrum/action-ids.json#L72). 

account: `0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860`

which corresponds to the Maxi LM Multisig, confirmed [here](https://quark-ceres-740.notion.site/Multisig-List-Guidelines-402e18cff13e4f2fa571bc14ed007546).

choices: No, this is not the way

cleaned.title: [BIP-323] Authorize Mimic Smart Vaults on Optimism & Polygon

raw.title: [BIP-323] Authorize Mimic Smart Vaults on Optimism & Polygon
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### [PR with Payloads](https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/255)

### Motivation

After BIP-115 passed late last year work began to create Mimic smart vaults that automatically collect protocol fees, sell for USDC, then bridge it back to Ethereum if necessary. The Maxis have recently conducted several tests in collaboration with Mimic and the Arbitrum smart vault is already fully operational after [BIP-294](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-294-authorize-mimic-smart-vault-on-arbitrum/4779). 

Tests have been completed in the Polygon and Optimism smart vaults. Both the Maxis and Mimic have high confidence all is working as expected. In case an issue arises the role for allowing the smart vault to call `withdrawCollectedFees` on the `ProtocolFeeWithdrawer` can be revoked with a future BIP.

### Risks

Assigning access to the fee collector gives the contracts assigned access to sweep all fees from the collector. In the very worst case, the fee collector could stop functioning correctly/start leaking funds.

Manual work is required in the process every 2 weeks to process veBAL fees and core pool bribes. In the event that there was a significant leak of value from the fee collector, It could take up to 2 weeks to notice, and then up to an additional week to enact governance to revoke rights to the fee collector.

As a result, there is some risk that up to 3 weeks of protocol fees could be lost. 

Here is a link to [Mimics audits](https://docs.mimic.fi/miscellaneous/security)

### Specification


#### Polygon
The DAO Multisig on Polygon `matic:0xeE071f4B516F69a1603dA393CdE8e76C40E5Be85` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` and call `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x25995e0bfb9b837ed9e3ed24df7d42689be47c45073cc1953bb0836b292faa13`

which corresponds to the role for calling `withdrawCollectedFees` on the `ProtocolFeeWithdrawer` on Polygon, verifiable [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/action-ids/polygon/action-ids.json#LL295C64-L295C130).

account: `0x94Dd9C6152a2A0BBcB52d3297b723A6F01D5F9f7`

which is the contract address for the Mimic smart vault on Polygon.


#### Optimism
The DAO Multisig on Optimism `oeth:0x043f9687842771b3dF8852c1E9801DCAeED3f6bc` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` and call `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x5a57bdde85c7a823e064d8cdc9a9a1b617f739068ec8925eaf6a562aa22513c6`

which corresponds to the role for calling `withdrawCollectedFees` on the `ProtocolFeeWithdrawer` on Optimism, verifiable [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/action-ids/optimism/action-ids.json#LL160C64-L160C130).

account: `0x94Dd9C6152a2A0BBcB52d3297b723A6F01D5F9f7`

which is the contract address for the Mimic smart vault on Polygon.

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: The proposal seeks to authorize Mimic Smart Vaults v3 on Optimism, replacing the current v2 architecture to process fees. This aligns with previous successful upgrades on other Balancer deployments, indicating continuity and improvement in the protocol's fee processing capabilities.
key_arguments_for: The upgrade to Mimic Smart Vaults v3 on Optimism mirrors previous successful migrations on Arbitrum, Polygon, and Gnosis, ensuring consistency across deployments.
The v3 architecture is ready to replace v2, and the revocation of v2 permissions will prevent redundancy and potential security risks.
Timeline voting metrics show unanimous and stable support for the 'Yes, let's do it' option throughout the proposal period.
Similar past proposals with analogous upgrades were approved and recommended with strong community backing.
key_arguments_against: No negative or opposing arguments were found in the forum discussion or voting timeline.
Forum sentiment is neutral, with no recorded positive or negative comments against the proposal.

evidence.quote: The Balancer / Beethoven X joint deployment on Optimism is currently Mimic’s smart vault v2 architecture to process fees. We are now ready to migrate to their v3 architecture, similarly to how it has already been done on other Balancer deployments.
Lead ratio by quartile is consistently 100% for the 'Yes, let's do it' option, indicating unanimous and stable support.
Voting power distribution and participation show solid engagement with no indication of opposition.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- Timeline metrics show unanimous and early support for the 'Yes, let's do it' option with perfect stability and voting power distribution.
- Forum sentiment is neutral with no opposition comments, indicating no significant community resistance.
- Historical similar proposals involving Mimic Smart Vault upgrades were successful and recommended, providing precedent and reducing risk.
- Market impact metrics show a modest positive token price change and minor TVL decline, not disqualifying the upgrade's potential benefits.
- The recommendation aligns with forum sentiment and timeline analytics, supporting a change to authorize Mimic Smart Vaults v3 on Optimism.
